universe: A Song of Ice and Fire
author: George R.R. Martin

reign_of_King_Viserys_I.description: Viserys I Targaryen's reign was marked by his indecisiveness, particularly in securing a clear line of succession.
reign_of_King_Viserys_I.heir_designation: Rhaenyra Targaryen was named heir by Viserys I.
reign_of_King_Viserys_I.conflict: The birth of Aegon to Viserys and Queen Alicent Hightower created a rival claim to the throne.

greens.supporters: Queen Alicent Hightower and many powerful lords

rhaenyra_targaryen.parentage: Daughter of Viserys I and Aemma Arryn

aegon_II_targaryen.parentage: Son of Viserys I and Alicent Hightower
aegon_II_targaryen.claim: Based on traditional preference for male heirs
aegon_II_targaryen.supporters: Queen Alicent Hightower and many lords

outbreak_of_war.viserys_I_death: Aegon II was crowned before Rhaenyra knew of her father's death.
outbreak_of_war.rhaenyra_reaction: Declared herself queen and rallied supporters from Dragonstone.
outbreak_of_war.division: The realm split between supporters of Rhaenyra and Aegon II.
outbreak_of_war.war_of_dragons: The conflict involved dragonriders on both sides, leading to unprecedented destruction.

key_battles_and_events.name: Storming of Dragonpit
key_battles_and_events.description: A mob in King's Landing stormed the Dragonpit, resulting in the deaths of several dragons and riders.

key_battles_and_events.name: Battle of Rookâ€™s Rest
key_battles_and_events.description: An early major confrontation where Rhaenyra's forces clashed with Aegon's, leading to heavy losses on both sides.

key_battles_and_events.name: Fall of Harrenhal
key_battles_and_events.description: Daemon Targaryen captured Harrenhal, making it a key stronghold for Rhaenyra.

key_battles_and_events.name: Second Battle of Tumbleton
key_battles_and_events.description: Rhaenyra's forces were betrayed by two dragonriders, leading to a significant defeat.

key_battles_and_events.name: Death of Aegon II and End of the War
key_battles_and_events.description: Rhaenyra briefly ruled after taking King's Landing but was captured and executed. Aegon II died shortly after, leading to the end of the war.

consequences.dragons: Most dragons were killed, leading to their near extinction.
consequences.house_targaryen: The family was greatly weakened, with many members dead or discredited.
consequences.realm_instability: The realm was left deeply divided, setting the stage for future conflicts.
consequences.regency_of_aegon_III: Aegon III, known as 'Aegon the Unlucky,' ascended the throne and ruled during a period of mourning and rebuilding.

legacy.destruction: The Dance of the Dragons is remembered as one of the most catastrophic events in Westeros.
legacy.symbolism: It serves as a symbol of the destructive potential of internal conflict and the costs of war.
legacy.historical_significance: The war's legacy influenced the actions and policies of future rulers and became a point of fascination for maesters and historians.
